gurmukhi: dwnn eyk lgXo bl ko gj isMG qbY ieh BwNq kihXo hY ]SyS suryS dnyS DnyS mhyS inSyS KgyS gihXo hY ]
transliteration: Daanan Ek Lagyo Bal Ko Gad Sing Tabai Eh Bhaant Kahiyo Hai|| Shesh Suresh Danes Dhanesh Mahesh Nishesh Khagsh Gadiyo Hai||
translation: Thundering in the battlefield, Gaj Singh said, “I have captured all the deities like Sheshanaga, Indra, Surya (Sun-god), Kuber, Shiva, Chandra (moon-god), Garuda etc.;

gurmukhi: ju`D ibKY Ab lau suin lY soaU bIr hnXo mn mY ju cihXo hY ]eyk AcMBv hY muih dyKq qo qn mY ks jIv rihXo hY ]1127]
transliteration: Juddh Bikhai Ab Lau Soun(i) Lai Sooo Beer Hanyo Man Mai Ju Chahiyo Hai|| Ek Achanndhav Hai Muhe Dekhat To Tan Mai Jeev Rahiyo Hai||1127||
translation: “Listen to me clearly; I have killed in the battlefield, whomsoever I wanted to kill, but I wonder why you have survived still?”1127.

gurmukhi: XoN kih kY bqIXw bl so brCw Duj sMjuq KYNc clwXo ]qau Dnu lY kir mY muslI soaU Awvq nYnn so liK pwXo ]
transliteration: Yon Kah(i) Bateeyaa Bal So Barchhaaddhuj Sanjout Khainch Chalaayo|| Tau Dhan(u) Lai Kar(i) Mai Mouslisooo Aavat Nainan So Lakh(i) Paayo||
translation: Saying this, he pulled and threw his lance, which was seen by Balram who was holding his bow in his hand;

gurmukhi: augR prwkRm kY sMg bwn Acwnk so kit BUm igrwXo ]mwnhu pMKn kO Aihvw Kgrwj ky hwQ prXo irs GwXo ]1128]
transliteration: Ougra Praaram Kai San Baan Achaanak So Kattee Bhoom Giraayo|| Maanoh Pankhan Kau Aihvaa Khaggraaj Ke Haath Daryo Ris Ghaayo||1128||
translation: With his great strength, he intercepted that lance and caused it to fall on the ground just like Garuda the king of birds catching and killing a flying serpent.1128.

gurmukhi: kop BrXo Aiq hI gj isMG lXo brCw Ar Er clwXo ]jwie lgXo muslIDr ky qn lwgq qw Aiq hI duKu pwXo ]
transliteration: Kop Bdaryo At(i) Higad Singh Layo Barchhaadar Or Chalaayo|| Jaae Lagyo Mousleedhar Ke Tan Laagad Taa At(i) Hidoukh(u) Paayo||
translation: In great fury, Gaj Singh struck the lance on the enemy, which hit the body of Balram; on receiving the blow of the lance, Balram suffered great agony;

gurmukhi: pwr pRcMf BXo Pl Xo jsu qw Cib ko mn mY ieh AwXo ]mwnhu gMg kI Dwr ky m`iD auqMg huie kUrm sIs aucwXo ]1129]
transliteration: Paar Prachanndd Bhayo Phal Yo Jas(u) Taa Chhab(i) Ko Man Mai Eh Aayo|| Maanoh Gadg Kidhaar Ke Maddh(i) Outan Hue Kooram Sees Ouchadyo||1129||
translation: That lance pierced through the body to the other side and its visible blade looked like tortoise protruding its head through the current of Ganges.1129.

gurmukhi: lwgq swNg kI sRI blBdR su sXMdn qy gih KYNc kFXo ]murJwie kY BUim prXo n mrXo sur biRC igrXo mno joq mFXo ]
transliteration: Laagad Saan Kisribalbhadra Su Syandan Te Gadh Khainch Kadhyo|| Murjhaae Kai Bhoom(i) Daryo Na Daryo Sur Brichh Giryo Mano Jot Madhyo||
translation: Balram pulled out the lance from his body and drooping down he fell upon the earth just as the Elysian tree, fully enlightened, falls down on the earth;

gurmukhi: jb cyq BXo BRm CUit gXo auT TwFo BXo mn kopu bFXo ]rQ hyr kY Dwie cVXo br so igr pY mno kUd kY isMG cFXo ]1130]
transliteration: Jab Chet Bhayo Bhram Chhodhttee Gado Outh Thaadho Bhayo Man Kop Badhyo|| Rath Her Kai Dhaae Chadyo Br So Gir Pai Mano Kood Kai Singh Chadhyo||1130||
translation: When he regained his conscious, he, realizing the situation, got highly infuriated; seeing the chariot, he jumped and mounted it like a lion jumping and ascending the mountain.1130.

gurmukhi: pun Awie iBrXo gj isMG so bIr blI mn mY nhI nYku frXo ]Dnu bwn sMBwir kiRpwn gdw irs bIc AXoDn ju`D krXo ]
transliteration: Poun Aae Bhiryo Gad Singh So Beer Balimai Nahinaik(u) Daryo|| Dhan(u) Baan Sanbhaar Kridaan Gdaa Ris Beech Ayodhan Juddh Daryo||
translation: He came forward again and fought with Gaj Singh and controlling the bow and arrows, sword, mace etc., he began to strike blows;

gurmukhi: joaU Awvq BXo sr S`qRn ko sMg bwnn ky soaU kwt frXo ]kib sXwm khY bldyv mhwN rn kI iCqqy nhI pYgu trXo ]1131]
transliteration: Jooo Aavat Bhayo Sar Shattran Ko San Baanan Ke Sooo Kaat Daryo|| Kabi Syaam Kahai Baldev Mahaan Ran Kichhit-te Nahipaig(u) Daryo||31||
translation: He intercepted the arrows of the enemy with his own arrows; the poet says that Balram did not retrace even one step in the battlefield.1131.
